# fix(infra): repair mealie dns resolution in prod

## Context
Mealie application is currently inaccessible in the Production environment.

## Problem
- `curl -I https://mealie.truxonline.com` fails with connection timeout.
- DNS resolution for `mealie.truxonline.com` returns a public IP (`217.70.184.38`) instead of the expected Internal VIP (`192.168.201.70`).
- ExternalDNS logs show `Skipping endpoint ... because owner id does not match, found: "", required: "prod-unifi"`.

## Root Cause
ExternalDNS cannot take ownership of the existing DNS record (likely created manually or by another controller without the correct owner ID) because of the TXT registry protection mechanism.

## Goal
Force ExternalDNS to take ownership of the record or manually correct the record so Mealie becomes accessible internally.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `dig +short mealie.truxonline.com` returns `192.168.201.70` (from internal network).
- [ ] `curl -I https://mealie.truxonline.com` returns HTTP 200/30x.
notes: PHASE:0 - T√¢che d√©marr√©e (branch: dev)

title: chore(maintenance): add cleanup script for empty ReplicaSets
description:
## Context
Over time, Kubernetes accumulates empty ReplicaSets from deployments updates. While not critical, they clutter `kubectl get rs` output.

## Current State
- Dev: 0 empty RS ‚úÖ
- Prod: 0 empty RS ‚úÖ
- Clean now, but will accumulate over time

## Task
Create automated cleanup script for empty ReplicaSets.

## Implementation
```bash
# scripts/cleanup-empty-replicasets.sh
#\!/bin/bash
# Delete ReplicaSets with 0 desired, 0 current, 0 ready

KUBECONFIG=${1:-./kubeconfig}
DRY_RUN=${2:-false}

kubectl --kubeconfig=$KUBECONFIG get rs -A -o json |   jq -r '.items[] | select(.spec.replicas == 0 and .status.replicas == 0) | 
    "kubectl delete rs -n \(.metadata.namespace) \(.metadata.name)"' |   if [ "$DRY_RUN" = "false" ]; then bash; else cat; fi
```

## Usage
```bash
# Dry run
just cleanup-rs dev --dry-run

# Execute
just cleanup-rs dev

# Add to justfile
cleanup-rs env='dev' dry='false':
  scripts/cleanup-empty-replicasets.sh terraform/environments/{{env}}/kubeconfig-{{env}} {{dry}}
```

## Safety
- Only deletes RS with 0/0/0 (desired/current/ready)
- Dry run by default
- Per-environment execution

## Scheduling
Optional: Add to monthly maintenance task or CI/CD

**üö® URGENT: Affects BOTH dev AND prod clusters**

**Root Cause:**
Cilium DNS proxy transparent mode is enabled (dnsproxy-enable-transparent-mode: true) but the proxy at 169.254.116.108 cannot reach upstream DNS servers (192.168.208.70/192.168.201.70), causing:

**Dev Impact:**
- DNS query timeouts (6+ seconds per query)
- CoreDNS instability (68 restarts on one pod since 5 days ago)
- Intermittent DNS resolution failures
- 12 timeout errors in last 200 log lines

- Could cause production outage if forward DNS starts timing out

- Prod: SAME error, more frequent\!
- Both clusters have dnsproxy-enable-transparent-mode: true

**Solution:**
Disable Cilium DNS proxy transparent mode in terraform/modules/cilium/main.tf:

```yaml
dnsProxy:

```

1. Apply to DEV first
2. Validate 24h (monitor CoreDNS restarts + timeout errors)
